title: Who will win the U.S. Senate election for Mississippi in 2020?
preds: Espy could win if a landslide happens but is unlikely.
Mississippi has a strong conservative base.
Most recent polls show  Republicans taking this race consistently across multiple pollstershttps://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/senate/mississippi/

Still seems like a long shot, but some state Dems are touting anticipated Black voter turnout: https://mississippitoday.org/2020/10/29/itll-be-higher-than-obama-mike-espy-will-benefit-from-record-black-voter-turnout-in-mississippi/ https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-election-forecast/senate/mississippi/ Trump is strongly favored to win Mississippi: https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-election-forecast/mississippi/
Updated to reflect the latest 538 probabilities

Cook Political Report this morning moved this race from Solid R to Lean R: https://cookpolitical.com/user/login?destination=/analysis/senate/senate-overview/final-2020-senate-overview-democrats-remain-favorites-take-senate
The state is conservative and has voted for Donald trump by a large margin in 2016 and therefore is very likely to vote for a republican senator
Chances are still very good for the Republican to win here, but not impossible for Espy to overtake her.
Democratic candidate Espy far superior to Republican, but it's Mississippi and most rural White voters would not vote for anyone who is Black.

Espy has driven his total up higher than it's ever gone, but the state seems to be solidly behind Donald Trump. Hard to imagine they would vote big for Trump and split with the Republican Senate candidate. If Espy wins here, the Senate is going to have a huge change over.

Bumping up from the 538 model, which has some uncertainty parameters that I suspect make a lot of sense at the national level but less so for Mississippi. They’ve gone Republican in the presidential election 1 straight times as well
https://ballotpedia.org/Presidential_voting_trends_in_Mississippi

'Pundits' are still generally listing this race as 'likely Republican' (at least). Polls have been scarce.  https://www.270towin.com/2020-senate-election/consensus-2020-senate-forecast https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_United_States_Senate_election_in_Mississippi#General_election
Using the 538 forecast as of Oct 21.
A GOP stronghold with a very difficult population to poll. This race is probably more in line with the 7 point victory Hyde-Smith had over Espy in 2018.

Mississippi is rated as the least elastic voter population, meaning this state is heavily entrenched on the Republican side.  While the news and funding campaigns seem to be building momentum for the Dem challenger, history and key political analysts in the Cook Political Report give Hyde-Smith a 91% chance of winning to maintain the state's shade of red.
Chances are high Hyde Smith will win, but Espy is not out of it yet. Not with Trump dragging down the ticket that is.
FiveThirtyEight gave R candidate 88% chance of winning as of October 19.

both the run off in 2018 and most recent polls show this as an extremely close race.  Democrats are outspending the republicans https://www.opensecrets.org/races/summary?cycle=2020&id=MSS1.  But the Republicans are the incumbents, which carries weight.  Democrats are targeting Senate seats to flip, but Mississippi may not be one thats close to the top of their list.

(Initial forecast:) The last Democratic Party Senator from Mississippi was John Stennis who retired in 1988. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_United_States_senators_from_Mississippi).  Republican Hyde-Smith defeated Dem. Espy in 2018's special election with margin of about 7%. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_United_States_Senate_special_election_in_Mississippi) Pundits currently rate the 2020 race as either 'safe Republican' or 'likely Republican'. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_United_States_Senate_election_in_Mississippi#General_election, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-election-forecast/senate/mississippi/) Polling is sparse thus far: https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/senate/mississippi/  Democrat Espy reportedly has the funding advantage: https://mississippitoday.org/2020/10/16/espy-uses-massive-cash-advantage-over-hyde-smith-for-ad-blitz-in-final-days-of-senate-race/ Leaving a small chance for the Dem. candidate mainly in case of a surprising 'blue tsunami' election nationwide. Strong Black voter turnout will likely be important for Dem. Espy's chances: https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-senate-elections-mississippi-4934ecdd79cb4f6c64f1a38bfeaf2149

I'm not going to say that there's "no" chance that the Democratic candidate has a chance.... but I believe that the Republican candidate will win so I don't see any reason to pull my punches, so to speak.
This seems like an odd thing to be predicting unless it's meant as a control or something, but at least it keeps me off the streets for a while longer.

538 + Economist forecasts, general polling, and long history of Mississippi elections generally going towards Republicans. Small chance for Democrat if African Americans turn out in large numbers and Republican enthusiasm damopens their turnout, particularly with coronavirus still being a threat.
